citation.article-title: Taxonomy of Corynebacterium diphtheriae and related taxa, with recognition of Corynebacterium ulcerans sp. nov. nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Corynebacterium ulcerans sp. nov. nom. rev.
Corynebacterium ulcerans (ul'ce.rans. L. part adj. ulcerans making sore, causing to ulcerate)

The salient characteristics of this species, based on previous data [1,2,4,5,18] and our observations, are as follows: Bacteria are nonmotile pleomorphic rods, arranged in palisades or V-shaped forms.
They are Gram-positive, non-spore forming and contain metachromatic granules.
They are non-acid fast, and no rod-coccus cycle is present.
They are catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
They are facultatively anaerobic.
Colonies (1 to 2 mm in diameter) on 5% sheep blood agar are grey-white and exhibit a light hemolysis, a dry aspect and a waxy consistency.
They are circular, slightly convex with an entire margin.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Acid is produced from D-glucose, glycogen, maltose, fructose and ribose but not from lactose, sucrose, D-xylose, and trehalose.
Some strains produce acid from mannitol.
Starch, DNA and urea are degraded but not tyrosine.
Gelatin is hydrolyzed at 25°C and at 37°C for some strains.
Esculin is not hydrolyzed.
The methyl red test is positive and acetoin is not produced.
Growth is visible in 6.5% NaCl for some strains.
Hippurate is hydrolyzed.
Alcaline phosphatase and alpha-glucosidase are produced but not pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonylarylamidase, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
As sole carbon sources, cells utilize glucose, arabinose, mannose, maltose and malate.
Utilization of mannitol and gluconate occurs variably.
Acetate, lactate, propionate, caprate, adipate and phenyl-acetate are not utilized.
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid, arabinose and galactose and mycolic acids of short chain lengths (C26 to C36). C. ulcerans strains can be isolated from animal and human infections.
The type strain is strain CCUG 2708 = National Collection of Types Cultures NCTC 7910.
It was isolated from a human throat.
This strain has all of the above properties.
Mannitol is utilized but not gluconate and acid is produced from mannitol.
Growth in 6.5% NaCl is visible.
The mol% G + C content of DNA is 53.
